title: Low interest rates and inflation may mean your savings will not cover funeral costs
text:
Low interest rates and inflation may mean your savings will not cover funeral costs Low interest rates and inflation may mean your savings will not cover funeral costs MANY people understand the importance of legacy planning, and make provision for their funeral in order to support their loved ones through a difficult time. PUBLISHED: 18:15, Tue, Aug 18, 2015 | UPDATED: 18:27, Tue, Aug 18, 2015 GETTY Funeral costs are continuing to rise and are outstripping inflation rates 
Any savings you have are currently being exposed to low interest rates and inflation which means when the time comes it is no surprise that the money you had put aside may not cover funeral costs.It is well documented that funeral costs have continued to rise and are outstripping inflation rates. 
In 2000 the average cost of a funeral was £1,580 and this rose to £3,527 in 2014, if this continues as predicted it could leave your loved ones with an unexpected and hefty bill. Protect against rising costs with a Prepaid Funeral Plan from Dignity Dignity guarantees to cover the necessary cost of a cremation funeral at today’s prices and once it’s paid for, the services included in the Plan are covered; regardless of how much prices rise or when the Plan is needed. 
This allows you to make better use of any remaining money you may have saved, or leave more behind for loved ones. Flexible payments The average cost of a funeral is substantial amount for loved ones to find at the time. 
With a Dignity Funeral Plan prices start from £3,335 and you pay in advance for the services included. 
You can opt for a single payment or instalments to suit you, meaning that you can take 1, 5 or even 10 years to pay. Related articles Funerals leave loved ones in debt as costs soar to £5,000 
Financial security Dignity is the only major Funeral Provider to publish a comprehensive Annual Report, available on request, providing complete transparency on how your money is protected. 
The money you pay for your Dignity Prepaid Funeral Plan is securely placed into the National Funeral Trust, which is independently managed by some of the UK’s most respected financial companies so you can be sure the money will be there when it is needed. Dignity, the Funeral Experts you can trust This year Dignity is proudly celebrating their 30th Anniversary since introducing the UK’s first ever Funeral Plan. 
This wealth of experience has enabled Dignity to gain valuable insight into the funeral market and develop a real understanding of customer needs to ensure that every funeral is of the highest standard and individual to the family concerned. 
In a recent survey over 98% of respondents would recommend Dignity to friends and relatives. 
To date Dignity has helped more than 650,000 people make provision for their funeral in advance, that’s more than any other provider. Straightforward application Taking out a Plan is easy, call Dignity to request a free information pack. 
You will receive a simple application form that can be completed in the comfort of your own home. 
You can put as much or as little detail into the plan as you wish or call us to discuss the details. 
Our award winning Client Service Centre is open 24 hours a day, every day of the year. 
A few minutes now could save you and your loved ones unnecessary worry and expense in the future.For your free no-obligation information pack call Dignity, the Express' chosen Funeral Plan Provider.
